intro: Licania capinensis, commonly known as the yellow mangrove, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and ability to thrive in saline environments. The plant has pinnately compound leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial species. Licania capinensis is also valued for its timber and has been used in traditional medicine by local communities.
